summary: This is an FBI intake document dated March 29, 2021, summarizing a call to the FBI National Threat Operations Center. The caller provided supplemental information regarding an alleged incident where she was taken to a conference in New York, got drunk, and was raped two nights in a row. The document also mentions two other young women brought to New York by the same man.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the case title for child sex trafficking. The document is an FBI intake related to allegations potentially connected to him.

events.title: FBI Intake Call
events.description: An individual called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report supplemental information regarding an alleged rape incident in New York following a conference.

events.title: Prior FBI Report
events.description: The caller had previously reported information to the FBI, referenced in serial number 590.

events.title: Alleged New York Conference Incident
events.description: The caller reported being taken to a conference in New York, getting drunk, and being raped two nights in a row. Two other young women were reportedly brought to New York for other conferences the same weekend by the same man.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI intake form related to a child sex trafficking investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein.
A caller reported supplemental information about being raped two nights in a row in New York after attending a conference and getting drunk.
The same man allegedly brought two other young women (a 22-year-old and a 19-year-old German exchange student) to New York for other conferences that same weekend.
The caller had previously reported information to the FBI on March 22, 2021.
The names of the caller, the alleged perpetrator, and the other young women are not provided in the unredacted portions of this excerpt.
